results.title: How to keep a job
results.brief_description: Discusses the habits and attitudes that make for job success once the job is obtained. A man seeking a new job after being fired at his last job is interviewed by the Personnel director of a company and is told that employers want men who are dependable, willing to work, co-operate, loyal and possess initiative.
results.description: Discusses the habits and attitudes that make for job success once the job is obtained. results.title: A Half million teenagers
results.brief_description: Studies the physiology aspects of venereal disease. Uses animation to show how the organisms of gonorrhea and syphilis enter and affect the body and how the diseases may be recognised. Stresses the need for treatment, pointing out that there is a cure for both diseases.

results.title: Angry Boy
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby, Aram Boyajian, Alexander Hammid and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: An analysis of the emotional disturbance of a boy whose hostility finds expression in terms of stealing. Through the help of a child guidance clinic, this hostility is traced back to the source in the home life of the child where a good and well-intentioned mother has been taking out her hostility toward her mother and her husband in an over-protective attitude toward the child. The film then develops as it describes the process in which the child is helped by guidance personnel in his way to recovery. Cinematography by Peter Glushanok.

results.title: In conversation with Chris Dercon and Kaat Debo
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Richard Greenhalgh, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
This free talk was held at ACMI on 17 July 2013 to celebrate two exhibitions, ACMI’s ‘Hollywood Costume’ and RMIT University Design Hub’s ‘Walter Van Beirendonck; Dream the World Awake’.

Chris Dercon, director of London’s Tate Modern, and Kaat Debo, director/curator at Mode Museum in Antwerp, discussed the particulars of exhibiting fashion and costume, and explored the dialogue between art and fashion.

They investigated the ways a curator can animate clothes through multisensory and multimedia experiences, Dercon and Debo looked at the approaches taken by curators, identifying interesting narratives for exhibiting garments and took the audience behind-the-seams of fashion and costume exhibiting.

results.title: The People's land
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Donald Taylor and Strand Films
results.brief_description: In Britain the National Trust has acqired a number of estates and areas of land of historical interest: they include ancient castles, such as the 14th century Bodian castle, a Chiltern village, the famous valley of Dovedale, a number of prehistoric stone circles, 14,000 acres of Westmorland countryside and an extensive area of downland in Sussex. These estates and landmarks are held in public trust forever.

results.title: Queen cotton
results.creator_credit: C Beaumont, Cecil Musk and Merton Park
results.brief_description: Looks at the cotton industry in Lancashire which, in the middle of this century, supplied most of the world with cotton goods. Features cranes on the docks in Manchester unloading cotton from all over the world to supply the looms of Lancashire. Includes a fashion shows highlighting cotton fabrics used by well-known British designers. Photographed by Jimmy Rogers, music by William Alwyn and editing by C. Beaumont.

results.title: Behind the menu
results.brief_description: A survey of the use of gas in commercial cooking and industrial establishments. The film includes glimpses of what happens “behind the menu” at establishments like the Menzies Hotel, The Royal Melbourne Hospital, the canteen at General Motors and a biscuit factory.

results.title: Game Masters: an evening with Tetsuya Mizuguchi
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Jim Arneman, ACMI Screen Events and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Join music gaming legend, artist and auteur, Tetsuya Mizuguchi, as he plays some of his seminal games and speaks about his signatory sound and visual fusion.

Famed for his pioneering application of music and visuals, Mizuguchi uses music not just as an accompaniment to a game, but as an integral part of its gameplay. Including traditional videogames, such as the hugely successful ‘Sega Rally Championship’, Mizuguchi has worked on some of the most original and unconventional music-fusion titles, including ‘Space Channel 5’, ‘Lumines’, ‘Rez’ and his latest opus, ‘Child of Eden’.

During this hosted conversation Mizuguchi explores how his vision has evolved over his career and demonstrates his pioneering application of music and visuals through live gameplay.

results.title: Game Masters: Rob Murray interview
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the ‘Game Masters’ exhibition, Rob Murray speaks about his career as a game designer. Starting out as a solo developer for hire to becoming CEO of Firemint, Murray is one of the most successful indie game developers in existence.

Firemint’s success is due to Murray’s vision to create games such as ‘Flight Control’(2009) and’ Real Racing’ (2009), which are both easy to play and elegant and addictive in equal measure. In addition, his prescient reading of the drive towards personalised gaming, led by the ubiquity of social networking on mobile platforms, has kept his games on trend – ‘Flight Control’, for example, allows players to choose music from their personal libraries to accompany the game.

Rob talks about the rise of mobile based gaming and the development of ‘Flight Control’ and ‘Real Racing’ .
